instruction: Generate a quiz with 5 MCQs about computers.
output:
Q. What does RAM stands for?
A. Random Access Memory
B. Read and Memory 
C. RAM and ROM 
D. Rainbow and Memory

Q. What is the full form of CPU?
A. Central Processing Unit
B. Compensatory Processing Unit
C. Central Processor Unit
D. Computing Processing Unity 

Q. What is the main function of a hard drive?
A. To store programs and data
B. To run programs
C. To output audio and video
D. To transmit data

Q. What is the main difference between a modem and a router?
A. Modems send data while routers receive data
B. Modems are used to connect to the internet while routers are used to connect to a network
C. Modems send and receive data while routers only send data
D. Modems are wired while routers are wireless 

Q. What is an optical drive used for?
A. To read CDs and DVDs
B. To print documents
C. To transfer data
D. To store data

instruction: Divide the following statement into two meaningful questions.
input: What is the impact of global warming on the environment and human life?
output:
What is the impact of global warming on the environment?
What is the impact of global warming on human life?

instruction: Generate a descriptive title for the following article that conveys the main point.
input: Air pollution has been increasing in cities around the world over the last few years. Pollutants like carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide, ozone and nitrogen oxides are released into the air by various daily activities like burning fuels in transportation and industry, affecting air quality for residents and even leading to adverse health effects.
output: Air Quality Declining in Cities Around the World: Increasing Pollutants from Daily Activities Affecting Health

instruction: Generate a personal story backed by facts about the following topic.
output: My family has recently decided to switch to solar energy, and it has been one of the best decisions we have ever made. We have quickly noticed a drop in our monthly electricity bills, and are reducing our carbon footprint. Plus, solar energy is limitless, renewable and available almost everywhere. It was the perfect solution for our home, and I'm so glad we chose to make the switch!

instruction: Write a paragraph that expands on the following idea.
output: The internet is a constantly evolving entity, part of a larger digital landscape that is constantly growing and shifting as new technologies are developed and new uses are made of existing technologies. Every day, new innovations emerge that make our lives easier, enable new opportunities, and open up previously unexplored possibilities. As the internet continues to advance, it will enable even more powerful applications, revolutionizing the way we communicate, work and collaborate with each other.

instruction: Introduce a real-world example that applies to the following statement.
input: AI is being used to process large amounts of data.
output: AI is being used for a variety of tasks, from medical diagnoses to autonomous car driving. For example, Google is using AI to process massive amounts of satellite data to map out the world in real time.

instruction: Create an invoice for a client.
input:
Client: Joe Smith
Products purchased: 2 bottles of shampoo, 1 bar of soap
output:
Dear Joe Smith,
 
Thank you for your purchase! 
 
Invoiced amount: $

instruction: Generate an adjective for each animal on the list, output a comma-separated list of adjectives.
output: Majestic, Gigantic, Imposing

instruction: Modify the sentence given by removing a word and output the modified sentence.
input: The ship ventured into the dangerous storm.
output: The ship ventured into the storm.

instruction: Identify the sentence structure of the sentence, output the sentence structure type.
input: Andrew gave money to the charity.
output: Subject-Verb-Object

instruction: Output the definition of gravity given this sentence.
input: Gravity is the force pulling objects together.
output: Gravity is a natural phenomenon by which all physical bodies with mass are brought toward each other, such as objects in the Earth's gravity thatcause objects to fall toward the Earth's surface, and the Moon's gravity that causes the ocean tides.

instruction: Rearrange the sentences into a coherent story, output the story.
input: (1) The family set off on holiday. (2) They stopped off for a picnic in the park. (3) On the horizon, a rainbow appeared. (4) They waited for the rain to stop.
output: The family set off on holiday and stopped off for a picnic in the park. As they waited for the rain to stop, a rainbow appeared on the horizon.

instruction: Pick the right word in the list that completes the sentence, output the word.
input:
The _____ between the two parties was deep-seated
a. feud
b. clash
c. link
d. alliance
output: a

instruction: Calculate the sum of the numbers in the list, output the answer.
Select the incorrect word choice in the sentence, output the word.
input: Serena has being learning French for two years.
output: being

instruction: Output a related term to the word given.
output: Football

instruction: Identify the sentence forming a wrong comparison. Output the sentence.
input: (1) He is more handsome than he is smart. (2) She is more creative than intelligent.
output: He is more handsome than he is smart.

instruction: Generate a word that defines the noun given.
output: Journey

instruction: Remove items from the list that do not fit the description.
output: Bananas, apples, strawberries, oranges

instruction: Identify three measures that can be taken to mitigate climate change.
output: Three measures that can be taken to mitigate climate change include: reducing emissions of greenhouse gases by using renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind; conserving the planet's resources, such as forests and oceans; and implementing sustainable farming practices that use less water and less fertilizer.

instruction: Write two sentences that use the same adjectives to describe a picnic.
output: The picnic was delightful, with cheery conversations and a pleasant atmosphere. We had a wonderful time, surrounded by lush greenery and cheerful laughter.

instruction: What would you do if you had access to unlimited resources?
output: If I had unlimited resources, I would use them to fund educational initiatives, invest in innovative solutions to environmental issues, and support philanthropic causes.

instruction: Name two governments in conflict.
output: Two governments in conflict are the United States and Iran, and India and Pakistan.

instruction: Create a poems using the same words.
output:
My feet in the sand, 
The sun kissing my skin, 
The sea dancing in joy.

Swaying to the music of the sea, 
The sun forever shining bright, 
My toes digging in the sand.

instruction: Generate one sentence about the importance of education for all.
output: Education is essential for developing the skills needed to succeed in life and foster a better future for everyone.
